meanings.definition: Relating to or involving a catalyst.
meanings.sent1: The catalytic converter helps reduce harmful emissions from cars.
meanings.sent2: The presence of a catalytic agent in the reaction sped up the process.
meanings.sent3: The catalytic effect of the enzyme made the chemical reaction seem like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement was like a catalytic force that propelled him to pursue his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The catalytic role of the teacher in sparking curiosity in students was truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: Causing or accelerating a reaction or change.
meanings.sent1: The catalytic impact of his speech motivated the audience to take action.
meanings.sent2: The addition of a catalyst had a catalytic effect on the reaction rate.
meanings.sent3: Her enthusiasm was so catalytic that it made everyone want to join in.
meanings.sent4: The new policy had a catalytic effect on improving workplace morale.
meanings.sent5: The catalytic nature of his leadership style transformed the team dynamics positively.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to bring about change or action.
meanings.sent1: His words had a catalytic power that inspired others to follow his lead.
meanings.sent2: The catalytic properties of the substance made it ideal for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke had a catalytic effect, causing everyone to burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The artist's bold strokes were catalytic in creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The catalytic influence of her kindness spread throughout the community.
